qas.question: What shattered the unity of the Catholic Church?
What are the series of events that ended centuries of prosperity in Europe, starting around 1300, known as?

answers.text: the Crisis of the Late Middle Ages

qas.question: In what years was the Great Famine?
Which two countries experienced peasant uprisings?
What major conflict occurred in Europe during the Crisis of the Late Middle Ages?
What saved the unity of the Catholic Church?

plausible_answers.text: Crisis of the Late Middle Ages

qas.question: What are the series of events that ended centuries of prosperity in Europe, starting around 1400, known as?
In what years wasn't the Great Famine?
Which two countries never experienced peasant uprisings?
What minor conflict occurred in Europe during the Crisis of the Late Middle Ages?

context: Around 1300, centuries of prosperity and growth in Europe came to a halt. A series of famines and plagues, including the Great Famine of <a2_0><b7_0>1315–1317<b7_0/><a2_0/> and the Black Death, reduced the population to around half of what it was before the calamities. Along with depopulation came social unrest and endemic warfare. <a3_0><b8_0>France and England<b8_0/><a3_0/> experienced serious peasant uprisings, such as the Jacquerie and the Peasants' Revolt, as well as over a century of intermittent conflict in the <a4_0><b9_0>Hundred Years' War<b9_0/><a4_0/>. To add to the many problems of the period, the unity of the Catholic Church was shattered by <a0_0><b5_0>the Western Schism<b5_0/><a0_0/>. Collectively these events are sometimes called <a1_0>the <b6_0>Crisis of the Late Middle Ages<b6_0/><a1_0/>.
